definitions: stick fast to a surface or substance
to give support or maintain loyalty
examples: the stamp failed to adhere to the envelope
adhere to traditional values

definitions: to recognize the rights, authority, or status of
to admit the truth or existence of
examples: they acknowledged him as their leader
she readily acknowledged her mistake

definitions: something intended to make life more pleasant or comfortable
examples: this hotel give us good amenities

definitions: having knowledge or perception of a situation or fact
examples: he was aware that a problem existed

definitions: only just, almost not
examples: he barely talked to me

definitions: prejudice in favor of or against one thing, person, or group compared with another
examples: his natural bias was to respect things as they were

definitions: a real or imagined line that marks the edge or limit of something
examples: those two trees mark the boundary of our property

definitions: in a general way
without considering specific examples or all the details
examples: people broadly agree that government should care about the population
broadly speaking, I agree with you

definitions: annoyed, upset, disappointed
examples: I was really bummed because my car broke down and I couldn't go to the party

definitions: adhere or stick firmly or closely to
be hard to part or remove from
examples: the smell of smoke clung to their clothes
don't cling to the first thing you see

definitions: open resistance, bold disobedience
examples: any defiance of the authoritarian regime would have dire consequences

definitions: a statement that you are not responsible for something
examples: the disclaimer reminded viewers that the movie is a drama, not a documentary

definitions: to improve the quality, amount, or strength of something
examples: a judge ordered the disclosure of the documents

definitions: to increase or improve in value, desirability, or attractiveness
examples: this dictionary enhance listening skills and comprehension

definitions: at or to a greater distance or more advanced point
examples: I used to live close to school, but now I live farther

definitions: a horizontal main structural member (as in a building or bridge) that supports vertical loads and that consists of a single piece or of more than one piece bound together
examples: the bridge over the river is supported by strong girders

definitions: excessive speed or urgency
examples: in her haste, she slammed her shoulder against the stall

definitions: the main offices or center of operations of an organization, such as the army, police, or a company
examples: the airline headquarters is in Boston

definitions: inside or contained within something else
examples: an inner courtyard

definitions: a huge, powerful, and overwhelming force or institution
examples: he knows the web could be a juggernaut for promotion and sales of his products

definitions: used in writing to represent an informal way of saying 'kind of'
examples: I think it's kinda funny

definitions: to let a substance or light in or out through an opening
intentionally disclose
examples: the roof was leaking
who had a motive to leak the story?

definitions: a removable or hinged cover for the top of a container
examples: the lid is fully detachable

definitions: extremely good or pleasing
examples: you have done a marvelous job

definitions: showing lack of experience or knowledge
examples: a naive belief that all people are good

definitions: obtain goods or a service from an outside or foreign supplier, especially in place of an internal source
examples: the company outsources the payroll management

definitions: to gain an advantage or victory over
succeed in dealing with a problem or difficulty
examples: after a tough battle, they overcame the enemy
she overcame a leg injury and is back running again

definitions: coming before in time, order, or importance
examples: passengers may board the plane twenty minutes prior to departure

definitions: likely to do, get, or suffer from something
lying on your chest, with your face looking down
examples: as a child, he was prone to ear infections
the injured player was lifted into a cart and driven off the field in a prone position

definitions: in preference to
more accurately, more exactly
examples: I'd rather wear the black shoes
these were not common criminals, but rather enemies of the state

definitions: in relation to, about
examples: I have a question regarding your last statement

definitions: to depend on or trust someone or something
examples: you can't rely on good weather for the whole trip

definitions: for the purpose of, in the interest of, in order to achieve or preserve
examples: the couple moved to the coast for the sake of her health

definitions: a broad band of cloth worn about the shoulders, around the neck, or over the head
examples: he was wearing a hat and scarf against the cold

definitions: make great efforts to achieve or obtain something
examples: I will strive to overcome these problems

definitions: not loud, bright, noticeable, or obvious in any way
small but important
examples: the room was painted a subtle shade of gray
there is a subtle difference between these two plans

definitions: in the direction of
examples: I walked toward the front door

definitions: showing no prejudice for or against something
examples: they give clear, unbiased advice

definitions: disappear suddenly and completely
examples: Dinosaurs vanished from the face of the earth millions of years ago

definitions: the ability to use your knowledge and experience to make good decisions and judgments
examples: I certainly hope to gain a little wisdom as I grow older

definitions: to shout something loudly
examples: he score and the fans yelled at him
